byline.contributor: Nate Schweber reported from Goshen, and Lisa W. Foderaro from New York.
byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER and LISA W. FODERARO

abstract: Attorney for Angelika Graswald, in pretrial hearing, attempts to establish his client's lack of understanding of her Miranda rights during 11-hour police interrogation that led to charges of second-degree murder in 2015 drowning death of fiancee Vincent Viafore.
lead_paragraph: After she had been read her Miranda rights, Angelika Graswald, who is charged with the murder of her fiancé, did not know what those were, her lawyer said.

headline.main: ‘Who’s Miranda?’ Suspect in Kayak Killing Didn’t Understand Her Rights, Lawyer Says
headline.print_headline: Woman Charged in Kayak Killing Didn’t Understand Her Rights, Lawyer Says

snippet: After she had been read her Miranda rights, Angelika Graswald, who is charged with the murder of her fiancé, did not know what those were, her lawyer said.
